sub_title: Social Entrepreneurship | Sustainable Livelihoods | Local Development
summary:
I am a captivating East African social entrepreneur [currently based in The Netherlands], curator, and collaborator of innovative solutions for opportunity collaboration, youth employability, challenge-driven education, start-up vision planning, community organizing, resource mobilization, research, social impact, leadership gaps, entrepreneurial competencies, child rights, and public policy reforms. 

Currently, I am teaching at Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University in the Responsible Business Leadership course. This position is a perfect intersection of my educational interests and my professional experience making a perfect harmony in social entrepreneurship. We explore themes in global sustainability, personal responsibility, leadership  and ethics in business.

I have close to a decade of working experience with governmental, non-profit organizations, and educational institutions on different development and humanitarian themes. I.e. resource mobilization, philanthropy, child protection, sustainability, HIV and AIDS programs, donor & and investor relations, youth empowerment, advocacy campaign management, capacity building, reproductive health and rights, gender-based violence (GBV), decent work, and economic development. 

As a local economic development specialist, I hold the belief that the crisis of global problems can be answered through "global exchange for local change." Further to this, I research fiscal decentralization, child poverty, public-private partnerships, and social value chains.

I enjoy working with communities empowering them for positive change by employing modern tools in facilitation and ICT seasoned with some humor. My future plan is to work with multiple stakeholders to address poverty and injustice through policy cohesion, research, and entrepreneurial competencies.

My professional strengths revolve around training and facilitation, research, advocacy, project proposal writing, oration, blogging, event organizing and coordination, business development, donor and partner engagement, process improvement, copy editing, administration, public relations, research, children and youth programs, recruitment and fundraising.

Away from my listed professional life, during my free time, I turn my passion to profit under my registered sole proprietorship, Krown Services in Beauty, Personal, and care work.
I also invest my time in mentorship and select community volunteer activities.

There is a role for everyone to play. Will you respond to the clarion call?

projects.title: SIMAMA NA MIKE
projects.description:
We successfully fund raised  for Michael Mwangi's medical bill for a surgery that took place in India. He has been on a wheelchair for about two years now after a life changing road accident that left his spinal cord damaged.
We look forward to a quick recovery for him.
You can donate at Paybill Number: 488700 Account:  MIKE or write to us on simamanamike@gmail.com

company.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

profile_positions.company: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University
profile_positions.description:
Tutoring the future generation of international business leaders in the course; Responsible Business Leadership. I facilitate interactive workshops and grade exams on business ethics and sustainability for 120+ BSc. International Business Administration students. As a team, we encourage them to become critical, creative, caring, and collaborative thinkers and doers.

Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University (RSM) is a leading European business school, ranked consistently among the top three business schools in Europe for research and 17th worldwide. RSM provides ground-breaking research and education furthering excellence in all aspects of management and is based in the international port city of Rotterdam – a vital nexus of business, logistics and trade. RSM’s primary focus is on developing business leaders with international careers who carry their innovative mindset into a sustainable future thanks to a first-class range of bachelor, master, MBA, PhD and executive programmes. RSM also has an office in Chengdu, China.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

company.name: The Africa Philanthropy Network (Formerly The African Grantmakers Network)

profile_positions.company: The Africa Philanthropy Network (Formerly The African Grantmakers Network)
profile_positions.description:
The Africa Philanthropy Network (APN) is an independent, not-for-profit, organizational member-based continent-wide network with a commitment to building a broad, multi-stakeholder understanding and recognition of the contribution of philanthropy as a field that bridges development and local ownership.

In my writing, I seek to support APN to establish a strong voice for African philanthropy in order to address the growing challenges of conflict, poverty, and bad governance. I share the belief that Africa can effectively mobilize and harness domestic resources for its own development.
profile_positions.title: Contributing Writer

Session: Unlocking Blue Finance for Coastal Communities and Climate-Resilient Coral Reefs

company.name: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam

profile_positions.company: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam
profile_positions.description:
Course: The Making of Development

The course is a critical introduction to theories and strategies of international development – looking at the making, unmaking and remaking of development from cultural, historical, and political economic perspectives. It aims to build a dialogue between the students’ own experiences and knowledges of development with the different approaches of the course literature from development studies and beyond. The course fosters an open learning environment using participatory interactive methodology in order to encourage self-reflection and co-learning knowledge generation.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.company: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam
profile_positions.description: An Exercise in Worldmaking is a collection of original MA student essays written, selected, and edited by the students themselves. First published in 2006, each subsequent MA batch has produced an edition, each of which reflects the insights and perspectives gained by MA students at ISS during their 15 months of study.
profile_positions.title: Student Editorial Board

profile_positions.company: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam
profile_positions.description:
As the President, I was mandated to execute the following aims of SCHOLAS;

-To represent its members on all decision-making bodies.
-To exercise its power to solve problems with regards to academic and welfare matters of its members.
-To encourage the development and maintenance of bonds of international friendship and understanding among its members.
-To stimulate intercultural, social, cultural, and sports activities among its members.
-To promote lasting contacts and cooperation with persons and institutions in the Netherlands and wherever else is considered appropriate by its members.
profile_positions.title: President of SCHOLAS

profile_positions.description:

profile_positions.description:
HOREC is a Charitable Children's Organization (CCI) with a vision to be efficient and effective caregivers for Children infected and affected by HIV and AIDS in Kenya.

Achievements
-Initiated annual Red Ribbon Walks to sensitize the local community as well as sell red ribbons to generate income.
-Initiated weekly staff devotion.
-Designed an internal child reintegration strategy.
-Established a collaboration with St.Paul's University's industrial placement office to offer internships.
-Initiated a revamp of the office & center structures.
-Created a space for a library.
-Initiated monthly community service where the children participate to wash churches and interact with the locals to reduce stigma.
-Designed internal project monitoring & evaluation tools.
-Maintained international donor relationships.
-Successful funding of 3 proposals.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
The mandate of the Deputy Governor in the St. Pauls University Student Asociation (SPUSA) was to advocate for students living with disability, represent student academic needs to the administration & contributing to decision making.

Achievements.

-Led a successful campaign in raising USD 20,000 for a student living with a disability to get corrective spinal surgery in India.
-Representation of the SPUSA in the Quality and Assurance Management Committee.
-Featured 3 times in the SPU magazine for servant leadership.
-Installation of ramps across all 4 university campuses (Nairobi, Machakos, Nakuru & Limuru).
-Hosted two successful annual events: gala night & culture week.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Governor

The International Solidarity Forum (ISF) is an annual training event hosted at the United Nations and World Youth Alliance headquarters in New York City.

2021: 18th ISF on the theme, Assisted Suicide and Euthanasia. 
Delegates examined the "right to die" and what is required to respect each person's dignity in end-of-life care in light of law, policy, and practice, with a special concern for the protection of the vulnerable.

Roles and achievements
-Co-drafting of the declaration document with youth from 30 countries.
-Decision-making during ISF policy deliberation sessions.
-Administrative support to the WYA Africa regional office.
-Voting and lobbying for interests and changes in the policy drafts.

Relevant links
ISF: https://www.wya.net/programs/isf/
Declaration: https://www.wya.net/press-release/wya-releases-new-declaration-on-assisted-suicide-and-euthanasia/
Press release: https://www.wya.net/op-ed/today-well-be-brave/

The Youth Enterprise Development Fund (YEDF) is a state corporation under the Ministry of Public Service, Youth & Gender Affairs. The Youth Fund is mandated to create employment opportunities for young people through entrepreneurship. This is achieved by providing financial support and business development services to youth-owned enterprises. The Fund seeks to turn youth into job creators and not job seekers.

Roles and responsibilities.

Capacity Building for new volunteers.
Advocacy and networking for the fund.
Organizing empowerment campaigns.
Office administration.

Achievements
Recruited 1 volunteer from South Sudan
Initiated an partnership for industrial  placement with St. Paul's University

Roles and responsibilities

-Gain new networks.
-Recruit new students.
-Maintain a positive image through social interaction both offline & online.

Fishers of Men Trainers (FOMET) is a charitable, interdenominational ministry operating in Kenya.

Roles & Achievements
Course development, planning & facilitation of enriching, holistic and exciting annual end-of-year programs to challenge young people to live out their God-ordained purpose & engage in the Great Commission. 

-Development of the 2021 curriculum/manual under the theme, 'The Follow Factor'.
-Successful training of over 100 children & young adults in contemporary issues.
-Planning and management of discipleship training programs on-site (Enganim House).
-Launch of a new FOMET campus (FOMET Machakos).
-Hosting off-site meetings and programs.
-Speaker during the annual training programs.

Scripture Union is a global movement in over 120 countries around the world actively introducing children, young people and families to Jesus and helping them to meet God through the Bible and prayer. Each Movement shares the Gospel in ways appropriate to their culture and situation, so local ministry may include a whole variety of activities from running camps or school and student groups to producing Bible reading resources and working with poor and marginalized children.

Main role- Office assistant
Coordination of Youth Department Activities, Service Leading, Diocesan Treasurer and Praise and Worship
